title: Credit’s Suisse’s Warning Says More About It Than Other European Banks
sub_head: Europe’s lenders face rough times ahead, but the beleaguered Swiss company is an especially tough case
body:
The environment has turned more noxious for European banks, but Credit Suisse can’t be considered the canary in the coal mine.
The Swiss bank warned Wednesday that it would make a loss in the second quarter in both its investment bank and the overall company. It mostly blamed a worsening macroeconomic backdrop in Europe and Asia, two of its key markets. While external factors won’t have helped, Credit Suisse also is trying to dig itself out of a series of holes of its own making. The bank’s shares were hit much harder than peers, down almost 6% in European morning trading compared with a roughly 1% fall in the European banking average.
